definitions.definition: used for introducing a statement that makes the main statement in a sentence seem surprising

examples.text: Although the sun was shining, it wasn't very warm.
Although small, the kitchen is well designed.

definitions.definition: used to mean ‘but’ or ‘however’ when you are commenting on a statement

examples.text: I felt he was wrong, although I didn't say so at the time.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from the adverb all + though.
